rag_insights.general_tip:
Best Practices for Landmark

Best Practices:
• Visit during golden hour for photos
• Book skip-the-line tickets online
• Research viewpoints and photo spots
• Check if climb/elevator access available
• Allow time for surrounding area exploration

Common Mistakes to Avoid:
• Only taking photos, not experiencing
• Visiting at midday (harsh lighting, crowds)
• Not researching best viewing angles

Typical Duration: 1.5 hours
rag_insights.timing_tip:
Visit popular landmarks either early morning (sunrise) or late evening (sunset) for best photos and fewer crowds.

Reasoning: Golden hour provides best lighting. Most tourists visit midday. Temperature is also more comfortable.
Applicable to: landmarks
Confidence: high

rag_insights.general_tip:
Best Practices for Restaurant

Best Practices:
• Book popular restaurants in advance
• Eat during off-peak hours for better service
• Try local specialties
• Check reviews for tourist traps
• Budget: lunch cheaper than dinner

Common Mistakes to Avoid:
• Eating in most touristy areas (overpriced)
• Not checking dress codes for upscale places
• Arriving at peak times without reservation

Typical Duration: 1.5 hours
rag_insights.timing_tip:
Eat 1-2 hours before or after peak times (lunch: 12-2 PM, dinner: 7-9 PM) for shorter waits and sometimes better service.

Reasoning: Off-peak dining often means less crowded restaurants and more attention from staff.
Applicable to: restaurants
Confidence: high

rag_insights.general_tip:
Best Practices for Museum

Best Practices:
• Arrive within first hour of opening
• Research must-see exhibits beforehand
• Allow minimum 2-3 hours
• Many offer free entry on specific days
• Audio guides enhance experience
• Wear comfortable shoes - lots of walking

Common Mistakes to Avoid:
• Trying to see everything (causes fatigue)
• Visiting during peak afternoon hours
• Not booking tickets in advance
• Underestimating time needed

Typical Duration: 2.5 hours
rag_insights.timing_tip:
Visit museums within the first hour of opening to avoid crowds and have the best experience with popular exhibits.

Reasoning: Early morning visits typically have 50-70% fewer visitors. Most tour groups arrive after 10 AM.
Applicable to: museums
Confidence: high

travel_tips.tip:
Constraint Wisdom - Pace

Moderate pace: 4-5 activities per day, standard durations, balanced mix of major attractions and relaxation.

Visit popular landmarks either early morning (sunrise) or late evening (sunset) for best photos and fewer crowds.

Reasoning: Golden hour provides best lighting. Most tourists visit midday. Temperature is also more comfortable.
Applicable to: landmarks
Confidence: high

Visit museums within the first hour of opening to avoid crowds and have the best experience with popular exhibits.

Reasoning: Early morning visits typically have 50-70% fewer visitors. Most tour groups arrive after 10 AM.
Applicable to: museums
Confidence: high

Keep valuables in front pockets or inside jacket pockets, especially in crowded tourist areas and public transport.

Reasoning: Pickpockets target back pockets and loose bags in crowded areas.
Applicable to: all_destinations
Confidence: high

Keep digital and physical copies of important documents (passport, insurance, bookings) separate from originals.

Reasoning: Losing documents can ruin a trip. Backups enable quick recovery and replacement.
Applicable to: all_destinations
Confidence: high

Learn basic greetings (hello, thank you, please) in the local language - locals greatly appreciate the effort.

Reasoning: Shows respect and often leads to better service and friendly interactions.
Applicable to: non_english_destinations
Confidence: high
